name: opendevprefs
description: use the addon preference UI to turn on/off the preference for dev/debug firefox addons
author: woodyITService

preferences.name: javascript.options.showInConsole
preferences.title: javascript.options.showInConsole
preferences.description: Logs errors in chrome files to the Error Console

preferences.name: nglayout.debug.disable_xul_cache
preferences.title: nglayout.debug.disable_xul_cache
preferences.description: Disables the XUL cache so that changes to windows and dialogs do not require a restart. This assumes you're using directories rather than JARs. Changes to XUL overlays will still require reloading of the document overlaid.

preferences.name: browser.dom.window.dump.enabled
preferences.title: browser.dom.window.dump.enabled
preferences.description: Enables the use of the dump() statement to print to the standard console. See window.dump for more info. You can use nsIConsoleService instead of dump() from a privileged script.

preferences.name: javascript.options.strict
preferences.title: javascript.options.strict
preferences.description: Enables strict JavaScript warnings in the Error Console. Note that since many people have this setting turned off when developing, you will see lots of warnings for problems with their code in addition to warnings for your own extension. You can filter those with Console2.

preferences.name: devtools.chrome.enabled
preferences.title: devtools.chrome.enabled
preferences.description: This enables to run JavaScript code snippets in the chrome context of the Scratchpad from the Tools menu. Don't forget to switch from content to browser as context.

preferences.name: devtools.debugger.remote-enabled
preferences.title: devtools.debugger.remote-enabled
preferences.description: This adds a 'Browser Debugger' entry to the 'Web Developer' submenu of the 'Tools' menu.  The Browser Debugger can be used to debug the JavaScript code of extensions.

preferences.name: extensions.logging.enabled
preferences.title: extensions.logging.enabled
preferences.description: This will send more detailed information about installation and update problems to the Error Console. (Note that the extension manager automatically restarts the application at startup sometimes, which may mean you won't have time to see the messages logged before the automatic restart happens. To see them, prevent the automatic restart by setting the environment NO_EM_RESTART to 1 before starting the application.)

preferences.name: nglayout.debug.disable_xul_fastload
preferences.title: nglayout.debug.disable_xul_fastload
preferences.description: For Gecko 2.0+ (Firefox 4.0+). See this bug for more information. Although the bug has been closed, it is believed that this pref is still relevant.

preferences.name: dom.report_all_js_exceptions
preferences.title: dom.report_all_js_exceptions
preferences.description: See Exception logging in JavaScript for details
